title: How successful would Alex Van Halen have been if he hadn't been brothers with Eddie? - Quora

response.answer_text: Alex is a great drummer. Really. But when you are talking Eddie Van Halen, you are talking someone that transcends talent. Eddie was a phenomenon.  He had that extra special something. The secret sauce. Eddie was: TalentedTimelySurrounded by exceptional talent (Roth, Alex)CharismaticUniqueProlificMusicalA guitarist in a world of guitar musicNo matter how talented Alex is, he’s a drummer who doesn’t really sing. There were two other drummer-led bands around the same era: The Police  and Genesis  Make no mistake, Stewart Copeland was the leader of The Police for a loooong time. Now, he’s a Wikipedia page, and Sting has been an international superstar for 40 years. Phil Collins was the only drummer I know who truly dominated his band. Because he sang. Ballads.

Alex is one of the best drummers of his generation. But I doubt he gets into music if not for Eddie. Alex started out playing piano and then guitar; Eddie played drums. Alex got into playing drums only while Eddie was out delivering newspapers. After hearing Alex play Wipe Out!, Eddie decided to switch to guitar.
